verses.verse: Now Hiram<WH2438> <WH2361> king<WH4428> of Tyre<WH6865> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> to David<WH1732>, and timber<WH6086> of cedars<WH730>, with masons<WH7023> and carpenters<WH2796>, to build<WH1129> him an house<WH1004>.

And David<WH1732> perceived<WH3045> that the LORD<WH3068> had confirmed<WH3559> him king<WH4428> over Israel<WH3478>, for his kingdom<WH4438> was lifted up<WH5375> on high<WH4605>, because of his people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478>.
And David<WH1732> took<WH3947> more wives<WH802> at Jerusalem<WH3389>: and David<WH1732> begat<WH3205> more sons<WH1121> and daughters<WH1323>. more: Heb. yet
Now these are the names<WH8034> of his children<WH3205> which he had in Jerusalem<WH3389>; Shammua<WH8051>, and Shobab<WH7727>, Nathan<WH5416>, and Solomon<WH8010>,
And Ibhar<WH2984>, and Elishua<WH474>, and Elpalet<WH467>,
And Nogah<WH5052>, and Nepheg<WH5298>, and Japhia<WH3309>,
And Elishama<WH476>, and Beeliada<WH1182>, and Eliphalet<WH467>. Beeliada: also called, Eliada 2. Sam.5.16.

And when the Philistines<WH6430> heard<WH8085> that David<WH1732> was anointed<WH4886> king<WH4428> over all Israel<WH3478>, all the Philistines<WH6430> went up<WH5927> to seek<WH1245> David<WH1732>. And David<WH1732> heard<WH8085> of it, and went out<WH3318> against<WH6440> them.
And the Philistines<WH6430> came<WH935> and spread<WH6584> themselves in the valley<WH6010> of Rephaim<WH7497>.

And David<WH1732> enquired<WH7592> of God<WH430>, saying<WH559>, Shall I go up<WH5927> against the Philistines<WH6430>? and wilt thou deliver<WH5414> them into mine hand<WH3027>? And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto him, Go up<WH5927>; for I will deliver<WH5414> them into thine hand<WH3027>.

So they came up<WH5927> to Baalperazim<WH1188>; and David<WH1732> smote<WH5221> them there. Then David<WH1732> said<WH559>, God<WH430> hath broken in<WH6555> upon mine enemies<WH341> by mine hand<WH3027> like the breaking forth<WH6556> of waters<WH4325>: therefore they called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of that place<WH4725> Baalperazim<WH1188>. Baalperazim: that is, A place of breaches
And when they had left<WH5800> their gods<WH430> there, David<WH1732> gave a commandment<WH559>, and they were burned<WH8313> with fire<WH784>.
And the Philistines<WH6430> yet again<WH3254> spread themselves abroad<WH6584> in the valley<WH6010>.

Therefore David<WH1732> enquired<WH7592> again of God<WH430>; and God<WH430> said<WH559> unto him, Go not up<WH5927> after<WH310> them; turn away<WH5437> from them, and come<WH935> upon them over against<WH4136> the mulberry trees<WH1057>.

And it shall be, when thou shalt hear<WH8085> a sound<WH6963> of going<WH6807> in the tops<WH7218> of the mulberry trees<WH1057>, that then thou shalt go out<WH3318> to battle<WH4421>: for God<WH430> is gone forth<WH3318> before<WH6440> thee to smite<WH5221> the host<WH4264> of the Philistines<WH6430>.
David<WH1732> therefore did<WH6213> as God<WH430> commanded<WH6680> him: and they smote<WH5221> the host<WH4264> of the Philistines<WH6430> from Gibeon<WH1391> even to Gazer<WH1507>.
And the fame<WH8034> of David<WH1732> went out<WH3318> into all lands<WH776>; and the LORD<WH3068> brought<WH5414> the fear<WH6343> of him upon all nations<WH1471>.
